subject: Self Care
title: How Habits Form in the Brain
description: A 60-second lesson on How Habits Form in the Brain.

hook.text: The first time you drove a car, every action required focus. Now you drive on autopilot. Habits did that.

buildup.text: Repeated actions move from the prefrontal cortex to the basal ganglia â€” from conscious to automatic.

discovery.text: This transfer saves mental energy. Habits free up the brain's executive function for new challenges.

twist.text: The brain doesn't distinguish good from bad habits. It automates anything you repeat enough times.

climax.text: Automation is the brain's gift and its trap. Choose what you repeat because the brain will lock it in.

punchline.text: Your brain automates what you repeat. Choose well.

quiz.question: Where do habits move to in the brain as they become automatic?
